data.title: My girlfriend loves it!
data.text: My girlfriend loves this place more than I do, however, the food I order is always good. In my opinion, the menu is somewhat limited in selection and a little pricey. LOVE the desserts! We go back often, because like I said before, my girlfriend loves that place!

data.title: Food was good but...
data.text: Staff is friendly. Server brought drinks quickly. Food a little slow arriving. Had appetizers first. We had not silverware. Flagged down another server to get silverware. He went and we thought he was bringing some. Then we saw him at another table but had not brought us any silverware. We waited awhile longer while the food was sitting there getting cold. I went to go find someone to get silverware when our server appeared with silverware. Her explanation was the hostess was  supposed to bring it. Well I think that is not a good attitude. If you see that something is missing then get it. Food was good and the server was more attentive.

data.title: Evening Out
data.text: First the staff here are awesome, very attentive and polite. Food was great and so was the price. Pretty noisy but it was a pleasant night.

data.title: Applebee's Loves Vets
data.text: I like it that this restaurant gives Vets free meals on Veteran's Day and Memorial Day weekend. I salute the ownership and thank all those who care about veterans and their service.

data.title: Poor food a service
data.text: Don't go place is not managed well food is bad to much money. Go across the street to get better food

data.title: So disappointed
data.text:
We usually like Applebees. Food and menu are consistent. Waitress did not know what was on tap (said she'd only been there a month). Came back and asked if she'd found out what was on tap. No. Came back couldn't remember all, but didn't have the one we wanted. Another server said they had it in the bottle. Ok. We order, turns out they don't have any of the beer we want. 

Every one we've been to starts half price appetizers at 8 during the week, this one not until 9- very frustrating.

data.title: As good as an Applbee's gets, very happy
data.text:
We all know by now what to expect as far as menu & atmosphere at an Applebee's so I won't waste your time with menu qualms.  I visited on a Monday around lunchtime and was promptly seated.  I was led toward a high table but I was there to eat and review some book material so I asked for a booth--I hate those high tables with a passion-- and she was completely fine with my request and sat me where I asked.  My server came around very quickly and took my drink order.  She had the multiple flavors of lemonade (and I mean multiple) memorized and brought mine out w/in 2 min.  She then took my food order and it surprised me how fast it came.  I'd guess 7 min.  I could be off but it was faster than you might expect anyway.  I ordered the turkey club with fried green tomato (a new sandwich to their menu) and it was very good.  Came on some grainy (healthy!) bread and had somewhat of a strong feta cheese-like taste to it.  Maybe it was the special mayo, maybe it was the fried green tomato, not sure but it tasted great.  I was very happy with my choice.  It was filling and something I hadn't tried before. It seems they (Applebee's in general) over-season the fries badly.  This has been the case at numerous ones throughout the state I've noticed.  They would be some of the best fries in any restaurant if they only used about half the seasoned salt mixture.

Would/will visit again when I'm in the area.  

Otherwise very happy with this Applebee's.  Lunchtime midweek at Applebee's is a much more tolerable atmosphere than busy nights, especially weekend nights.
